ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this class I developed a greater understanding of film structure and the formal elements within a film. Leading a discussion also helped me to better engage with my peers and develop presentation leading skills.

Got exposed to a lot of significant films and directors in film studies. Loved the international and historical variety. Also liked learning about some key ideas in film theory (the uncanny, doubles, autonomous camera).

I learned how to use the elements of a film's form to draw conclusions about the film as a whole and about the larger industry. I also learned a lot about film from different countries and time periods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the films in the course were varied enough to keep the discussion interesting and different even if I did not like the films. I think the presentations could have more clip analysis so that the class can engage with the visuals more instead of trying to recall them. I think some more structure to the discussion might help to improve the quality.

Class time could be more structured. It was essential having the weekly student presentation linger for 2 hours, with very little engagement from other students most of the time. I didn't feel like I really understood what some of the film analysis terms meant.
It was engaging to watch a film weekly
More appropriate films and a clear understanding of why we are watching a given film. There needs to be clearer and more specific instructions when it comes to course assignments and expectations.

I really like the diversity in the syllabus - all the films were very different and highlighted different aspects of the genre. I also thought the assignments did a good job of making us think deeply about the films and be engaged with them.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: While I took this course because it was required I enjoyed it more than I thought I would. That being said I don't think it is a course that people would enjoy who are not film majors since the films aren't the most exciting.
Yes, it was nice to get to spend time learning about interesting films/directors.
I would recommend this course to another film major since it's a good deep dive into film analysis that would be helpful in later courses.
